title: Mario Balotelli subject of foul-mouthed rant from Bastia boss following Nice draw
text:

Bastia boss Francois Ciccolini unleashed a foul-mouthed rant at Mario Balotelli on Friday following Nice's 1-1 away draw at the Stade Armand Cesar. 
The incident occurred in the players' tunnel as footballers and staff from both teams exited the pitch. 
Although the details surrounding why the argument started are hazy, there is no reason to suspect that it is in anyway related to Balotelli's racial abuse claims. 
The Italian international claimed he was the subject of monkey chants from sections of the Bastia crowd during the game. Mario Balotelli turns to hear Francois Ciccolini in full force (Photo: Twitter/CanalFootClub) 
French football authorities have since launched an investigation into Balotelli's claim. 
However, at full-time, Balotelli can be seen saying something to Ciccolini which really ticks him off. Mario Balotelli during the Bastia vs Nice game (Photo: Icon Sport via Getty) 
The Bastia boss then replies: "Shut the f*** up. You respect nothing. Do you think I am scared of you? 
"You think I'm scared of you? Go f*** yourself - where do you think you are?" Like us on Facebook
